body: LEAD: A woman who first reported that her infant son was kidnapped, but then confessed to drowning him in a bathtub, was indicted yesterday on charges of first-degree manslaughter and falsely reporting an incident, the Brooklyn District Attorney's office said. body: LEAD: For years, Tony Triano of the Bronx said, the rest of the world seemed to have what his borough did not - cable television. Friends in Manhattan had Islanders' hockey games piped into their living rooms. His sister-in-law in Nyack, N.Y., could flick on movies at will. title: For Many New York Areas, Wait for Cable TV Ends

body: LEAD: About 8,000 Consolidated Edison customers in the Bay Ridge, Dyker Heights and Bensonhurst sections of Brooklyn lost power for parts of last night and early today. The blackout occurred when three power cables shorted out for an undetermined reason, said a spokeswoman for the utility. The blackout began at 9:50 P.M., and power was restored at
title: Power Goes Out in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: A Brooklyn woman who said she drowned her infant son to stop his colic-induced crying - and who originally concocted a kidnapping story -has reserved her right to testify before a grand jury, her lawyer said. title: Metro Datelines; Mother May Testify In Baby Drowning

body: LEAD: A judge agreed yesterday to permit the release on bail of a Brooklyn woman accused of drowning her 2-month-old son and then telling the police he had been kidnapped. body: LEAD: The 2-month-old son of a guard in the United States Marshal's office in Manhattan was kidnapped off a Brooklyn street yesterday morning by two men who drove up to the curb, jumped out of their car and snatched the infant from his stroller, the police said. title: Guard's Baby Snatched From Stroller
